summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on October 27, 2021, with the Chief Psychologist of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019. The psychologist was in charge of the MCC Psychology Unit responsible for mental health evaluations and treatments of inmates during that period.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate who was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July and August 2019; subject of the OIG death investigation.

events.title: OIG Interview of Chief Psychologist
events.description: Special Agent and Senior Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of the Chief Psychologist of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview of Chief Psychologist
events.description: FBI conducted an interview of the Chief Psychologist, as referenced by an attached FBI 302 document.

events.title: BOP After Action Review
events.description: BOP conducted an After Action Review, referenced as an attached document to the memorandum.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of the OIG's official investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein while he was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
The Chief Psychologist of the BOP at MCC New York was interviewed regarding mental health evaluations and treatments of inmates during the time Epstein was housed there (July and August 2019).

The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum references several attachments including the transcript, an OIG Waiver Form, an FBI 302 from August 29, 2019, and a BOP After Action Review from August 10, 2019.
The document contains a confidentiality notice stating it is the property of the OIG and should not be distributed outside the receiving agency.
